seeAlsoSections.title: Initializing SocialRadio for use with Tuned Global’s APIs

abstract.text: How to validate your client and start using the SocialRadio SDK with Tuned Global APIs

inlineContent.text: This document explains how to integrate SocialRadio with your application if it is already using Tuned Global’s backend to access tracks and metadata
In order to initialise SocialRadio against Tuned Global’s API and services you need the following:
Tuned Global Store ID
Tuned Global Application ID
Device Country Code

code: let config = SocialRadioConfig(apiKey: myAPIKey, country: countryCode, storeId: storeId, applicationId: applicationId)
// This means you are forbidden to use the Automix SDK or you have no internet connection.
// The Automix SDK public functions can be used from this point onwards :)

inlineContent.text: You can tweak the SocialRadio UI and available feature set by changing flags on the cofing object. See
SocialRadio requires your applications OAuth2 access & refresh tokens in order to take over playback, provided via

code: oldAccessToken: String?, refreshToken: String?, tokenType: String?,

inlineContent.text: SocialRadio requires your client’s authenticated device, provided via

code: public func asyncGetAuthenticatedDevice(deviceIdentifierForVendor: String, completion: @escaping (_ error: Error?, _ tunedDeviceId: String?) -> Void) -> Void {

inlineContent.text: SocialRadio requires a unique device identifier, generally the identifierForVendor provided by Apple should work: Provided via
The
is responsible for providing data required for the Radio UI to function, as well as presenting UI SocialRadio is not able to do on its own.
SocialRadio allows the user to add one or multiple tracks to a radio show. When that action is triggered, SocialRadio asks this delegate to provide the UI for selecting them. This is done via

code: // Your implementation for presenting UI that allows to select one or more tracks:
let tracklist = MyTracklist() { tracks, playlistName in
// - Feed the track/tracks selected as the second paramenter of the completion block,
// - If the tracks selected are part of a playlist, feed the name opf that playlist as the thirsd parameter of the completion block.

inlineContent.text: At a time where SocialRadio requires a Tuned User Id, if it does not have one it will require the user to authenticate via
At times, SocialRadio will need to present a users’ profile. It will do so via
At times, SocialRadio will need to know if a track is part of the user’s “Liked” playlist. It will ask the client application to do so via
SocialRadio allows for a user to flag/unflag a track as Liked. When that happens, it will do so via
SocialRadio also notifies this delegate when it will and has minimised the Radio UI, and whe it will and has closed the Radio UI. It does so via
The
is responsible for updating your player’s UI.
To check wether AutomixIQ is currently initialised, use

abstract.text: Called by SocialRadio when the Radio UI about to be dismissed
SocialRadio playback mode
Called by SocialRadio when the Radio UI is closed
Called by SocialRadio when it wishes to present UI to select one or many tracks
Broadcast your playlist, mix, or set along with your voice, to the world. Tune in to other broadcasts and jump in the conversation with comments, or show your support with quick reactions.
SocialRadioUIDelegate protocol defines the methods to be implemented by a class tasked with providing the Automix SDK the user interface requires for social features.
SocialRadio status variable type
SocialRadioStreamingDelegate protocol defines the methods to be implemented with providing SocialRadio the information it requires to display content and get recommendations.
Called by SocialRadio when it wishes to present UI with a user’s information
Called by AutomixIQ when initialised against a Tuned Global backend or when its access token has expired.
Called by SocialRadio when it needs to know wether a track is liked or not
Called by AutomixIQ to request the unique identifier for the users device as a string.
On iOS this is generally the Identifier for Vendor.
It can be any string as long as it is unique
AutomixIQ will use this string as the UniqueId if it needs to register the device for playback
Called by SocialRadio when the Radio UI is dismissed
Returns the initialised status of the Automix SDK.
Called by SocialRadio when it needs add or remove a track with a given identifier from liked
Called by SocialRadio when the Radio UI is closed
SocialRadioLogLevel is an enum of all the AutomixIQ available log levels
Called by SocialRadio when it wishes to present UI to authenticate a user
Called by AutomixIQ while initialising to give you an opportunity to provide the authenticated device ID or perform device authentication as required.
If not implemented, AutomixIQ will proceed to register a device for the logged in user with deviceType: “iPhone”, displayName: “AutomixIQ” and deviceOS: “iOS”.
